content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I have not received any new commands or developments since the previous summary. However, a command was executed on my computer to browse a website about the concept of time step in numerical analysis. The website did not provide a clear definition or explanation, but mentioned it as a topic. The command was initiated by the user with the question "What is a time step in numerical analysis?"'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide information on what a time step is in numerical analysis. It primarily provides information on the COMSOL software, including its products, support, and privacy policy. It also includes options for cookie preferences. \n \n Links: [' (https://www.comsol.com/)', 'Request Demonstration (https://www.comsol.com/request-a-demo)', 'Contact (https://www.comsol.com/contact)', 'Deutsch (http://www.comsol.de/multiphysics/time-step?setlang=1)', 'English (http://www.comsol.com/multiphysics/time-step?setlang=1)']"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_integration#Time_integration", "question": "What is a time step in numerical analysis?"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide a clear definition of a time step in numerical analysis. It focuses on numerical integration methods for calculating the numerical value of a definite integral and the history of quadrature. The text also mentions the use of differential equations in numerical analysis and various solution methods for such equations. \n \n Links: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_integration#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']"}]
"""
